    • Method Detail

      • convertASCII

        public byte[] convertASCII()
        This method will handle converting the ASCII floats to binary floats. Simply call object.convertASCII() to grab all the floats from the STL file and convert them to their respective byte form; also adding in extra necessary data such as 80 bytes for the header, 4 bytes for the number of facets in the file, and 2 bytes for an attribute byte count. By convention, the attribute byte count is always 0.
        Returns:
        The byte array containing the binary STL data.
        See Also:
        STLConverter.readInLines()

      • setPath

        public void setPath(java.lang.String path)
        This method sets the path of the STLConverter object.
        Parameters:
        path - The path to the STL file.

      • checkIfNullBinary

        public boolean checkIfNullBinary()

      • readInLines

        public boolean readInLines()
        This method will read in lines from the file whose path is given in the constructor, or manually set using the setPath(...) method. A regex pattern will be applied to each line to search for any float that is in scientific or normal form. e.g. -2.143e-001 ; 7.1394 ; 0.0
        Returns:
        True denoting if the operation finished successfully, false otherwise.

      • findStartIndex

        public int findStartIndex(java.lang.String[] list)
        This method will read in the first few lines of the list of strings looking for the pattern "facet normal". This will ensure the converter only converts numbers from actual facets, and not from any comments such as a date or version number, etc.
        Returns:
        The index of the first occurrence of the string "facet normal"
        See Also:
        STLConverter.readInLines()
